about.name: The following questions are from real DMV written tests. These are some of the actual permit questions you will face in California. Each permit practice test question has three answer choices. Select one answer for each question and select "grade this section." You can find this button at the bottom of the drivers license quiz.  For a complete list of questions and answers for California please visit https://cheat-sheets.dmv-written-test.com/en/california/car.

hasPart.text: Always be aware of what is happening around your vehicle. Constantly observing your surroundings to the front, sides, and rear of your vehicle will help you see problems that may require you to change speed or roadway position.

suggestedAnswer.text: Know what is happening around your vehicle.

comment.text: Know what is happening around your vehicle.

hasPart.text: Not getting enough sleep is a cause of poor driving behavior. Just like drugs and alcohol, sleepiness slows reaction time, decreases awareness, and impairs judgment.

suggestedAnswer.text: Help you to be a better driver.

comment.text: Help you to be a better driver.
Make you feel better.
Impair your judgment.
Impair your judgment.

hasPart.name: The safest precaution that you can take when using cellular phones while driving is:

about.name: The safest precaution that you can take when using cellular phones while driving is:

hasPart.assesses: The safest precaution that you can take when using cellular phones while driving is: | The safest precaution that you can take when using cellular phones while driving is: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: Minors may not use a cellular phone while driving, except for certain emergencies. Cell phones are allowed to be used by drivers over age 18, but a hands-free device should be used.

suggestedAnswer.text: To use hands-free devices so you can keep both hands on the steering wheel.

comment.text: To use hands-free devices so you can keep both hands on the steering wheel.

suggestedAnswer.text: To keep your phone within easy reach so you won't need to take your eyes off the road.

comment.text: To keep your phone within easy reach so you won't need to take your eyes off the road.

suggestedAnswer.text: To review the number before answering a call.

comment.text: To review the number before answering a call.

acceptedAnswer.text: To use hands-free devices so you can keep both hands on the steering wheel.

comment.text: To use hands-free devices so you can keep both hands on the steering wheel.

answerExplanation.text: Minors may not use a cellular phone while driving, except for certain emergencies. Cell phones are allowed to be used by drivers over age 18, but a hands-free device should be used.

comment.text: The safest precaution that you can take when using cellular phones while driving is: | Minors may not use a cellular phone while driving, except for certain emergencies. Cell phones are allowed to be used by drivers over age 18, but a hands-free device should be used.
